title.narrative: Community Emergency WASH Response for Extremely Vulnerable in Select Areas of Salamieh District

description.narrative:
Community Emergency WASH Response for Extremely Vulnerable in Select Areas of Salamieh District is a 12-month lifesaving and life-sustaining principled humanitarian response in the WASH sector. In line with the SHF 2020 First Standard Allocation Strategy Paper, UN WASH Cluster objectives, and AKDN’s Global and in-country frameworks, the response addresses urgent humanitarian needs with the principle objective of: Increased access to emergency WASH services and knowledge of safe and protective sanitation and hygiene behaviour and practices for affected and at-risk communities in the select sub-districts of Salamieh District: Salamieh peri-urban areas, Barri, Al-Saan, Saboura, and Oqeirbat. To achieve this objective the response works towards two inter-related outcomes:
- Outcome 1: Improved level of protective sanitation and gender-responsive hygiene practices among targeted vulnerable households and communities. This will be achieved by building local capacities to promote safe WASH practices and hygiene behaviours among different age groups and establish the foundation for trusted local platforms to deliver emergency humanitarian assistance and basic services in underserved areas. Besides, to ensure safe WASH practices and protect school students from COVID-19 infection risks during exams period, cleaning kits will be distributed to 52 exam centers targeting a total of 5,977 (2913F 3,064M) students at the exam’s centers within Salamieh district.
- Outcome 2: Project Outcome 2: Increased access to emergency water among targeted vulnerable households and communities. Under this outcome, vulnerable and severely water insecure communities will receive access to clean water via water trucking services in order to sustain human survival needs and maintain dignity.
Through these interventions the response will directly reach nearly 100,000 vulnerable people (over 50% women and girls) across Salamieh peri-urban areas, Barri, Al-Saan, Saboura and Oqeirbat. To the extent possible, interventions have been designed to be gender, age and protection-sensitive, and reach either broader or distinct segments of the population depending on the need and nature of the activity. As much as possible, these interventions have been coordinated with the UN WASH Cluster
